item.title: By: Reuben Anderson
item.dc:creator: Reuben Anderson
item.description:
I'd struggled with this myself. I think it's counter-intuitive and potentially just plain wrong for SQL to work this way.
I think most people would expect the default range to be the entire group, not just up to the current row. No?

item.title: By: T. Blom
item.dc:creator: T. Blom
item.description:
The good news is, in this case , is that you do not need to use window functions at all..
SELECT temp1.G1 as Group, temp1.V1 as Value from (SELECT Group as G1, Value as V1 FROM dbo.TestOver) temp1 inner join (SELECT Group as G2, Max(Value) as V2 FROM dbo.TestOver group by Group) temp2 on temp1.G1 = temp2.G2 and temp1.V1 = temp2.V2
which basically is a solution that is available for ages and works regardless for any version. Actually I may have posted similar solutions for all RDBMS systems on BI forums for more than a decade :)
